document.masterDocTitle: Taraxacum sect. Erythrocarpa in Europe in the Alps and eastwards: A revision of a precursor group of relicts

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taraxacum sect. Erythrocarpa in Europe in the Alps and eastwards: A revision of a precursor group of relicts

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Institute of Botany of the Czech Academy of Sciences, CZ- 25243 Průhonice 1, Czech Republic; & jan. stepanek @ ibot. cas. cz; https: // orcid. org / 0000 - 0003 - 4038 - 1998
Institute of Botany of the Czech Academy of Sciences, CZ- 25243 Průhonice 1, Czech Republic; & jan. kirschner @ ibot. cas. cz; https: // orcid. org / 0000 - 0002 - 6303 - 713 X

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type :—
GREECE . Pindus Tymph., Kalampaka , Hagios Stephanos ,
4 May 1896
,
P . Sintenis
, Iter Thessalicum 1896, no. 182
( PRC , no. det. 2139, lectotype , fide Kirschner & Štěpánek 1985: 128 ; isotypes: B , no. det. 12630; G , no. det. 22507; JE , no. det. 9160; K , no. det. 1986; WU , no. det. 611 & 9059)
.

Note :—In two herbarium collections, LD , no. det. 3797, and BRNM , no. det. 1693, the lectotype label text is specified by an extra label addition “in fauce Karawa” [in the Karawa gorge]. These two collections are ( LD ) the original personal herbarium of P . Sintenis, and ( BRNM ) the collection of J . Freyn who received plant material by P . Sintenis for identification to be distributed in the exsiccates. Both, therefore, should be considered as isolectotypes, too.
Illustrations :— Kirschner & Štěpánek (1985: 129 , 131, and Plate XI).

Exsiccates :—Sintenis,
Iter Thessalicum 1896
, no. 182; Taraxaca Exs., no. 26, 27.

Diagnostic notes :—A relatively isolated taxon among the European members of T. sect.
Erythrocarpa
. Outside Europe, it is very close to
T. cinnamomeum Kirschner & Štěpánek
of Lebanon and Israel , but the latter has cinnamon-brown achenes and does not develop pollen. The most similar European taxon is
T. olympophilum
. As already stated by Sonck (1993: 207–208) ,
T. olympophilum
has appressed to loosely appressed outer phyllaries (not erect to erect-patent as in
T. calocephalum
), interlobes not bordered, entire to denticulate (not narrowly bordered brown-purple and often with lobules or lobe base incisions, as in
T. calocephalum
), and achenes ca. 3.8–4.4 mm long, including cone 0.7–1.0 mm long ( 4.8–5.5 mm long, with cone 1.2–1.5 mm long in
T. calocephalum
, Fig. 22 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 22.
Taraxacum calocephalum
. A, Achenes (PRA, no. det. 16007). B, Geographical distribution.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution and ecology :—
Taraxacum calocephalum
is very widespread in northern and central Greece, scattered in other Greek regions, and there is a single locality known from Albania ( Fig. 22 ). There is a relatively wide range of habitats, including mountain stony or rocky slopes, mountain calacareous grasslands, road verges, open oak woodlands etc. Its IUCN conservation status is estimated as LC.

Specimens examined :— ALBANIA : “Mittel-Albanien, inter Prizren et Debra, M . Galica - Lums, in herbidis summi jugi supra pagum Bicaj” [ Central Albania , between Prizren (now in Kosovo ) and Debar (= Dibra ), mountains of Maja e Gjallicës (
2489 m
